g.text: SHAP Analysis: Climate Effects on Glucose Metabolism
Temporal Lag Patterns and Feature Interpretability
Sample: 2,731 participants • Features: 44 pure climate variables • Target: Fasting glucose metabolism
Key Finding: Temperature lag features dominate
1-5 day lags show strongest biological effects
1. SHAP Summary Plot: Feature Effects Distribution
• Each point = one participant • X-axis = SHAP impact on glucose • Color = feature value
• Blue = low values, Red = high values • Horizontal spread = effect variability
• Temperature lags dominate top 5 features • 1-5 day lags most important
• Biological plausibility: matches metabolic response timescales
• Non-linear relationship: higher temperatures → stronger glucose impact
• Color coding reveals interaction effects with other climate variables
• Shows how each climate feature pushes glucose prediction up or down
• Demonstrates individual-level model interpretability and decision transparency
Key Scientific Insights from SHAP Analysis
1-5 day temperature lags show strongest effects
Lag times match metabolic response patterns
SHAP reveals machine learning decision processes
